Name: Statue of Shed-So-Unefer-Toum and His Wife
Description: This statue is considered to be one of the masterpieces of Late Period art. It represents Shed-So-Unefer-Toum and his wife sitting on a low-backed chair. The sides are decorated with scenes of their sons and daughters. The couple is depicted with their legs side by side and with entwined hands, reflecting the warm and loving relationship between them. Both of them are wearing wigs that leave their ears free.
